column5: One of the portage lakes near our outpost saw considerable fire damage last year. Anyone with experience fishing walleyes in the wood during the fall? We'll be 100 miles north of Red Lake.

By some weedless jigs and throw them in the wood. ISG makes a slowfall jig that is great in wood. I use it on the Turtle Flambeau Flowage in Wisconsin which is full of wood and they are the best. http://www.isgfishing.com/ I have no connection to this product...only that I use it and they are great. I have had great success on beaver knockdowns for walleyes. I do not know if the wood is burned will it turn fish away.
A slip float with a plain hook and split shot works for me.
Thanks. I've heard of them before but did not know they were sold online.
